name: 2016_08_humanities_student_major_889_applyingtocollege
title: 2016-08-humanities-student-major_889_ApplyingToCollege.txt
content_scrubbed:
* I remember putting down some interdisciplinary medical-related major. The reason was because they wanted my SAT IIs to be related to my major, and I'd only taken subject tests in the humanities. 

* At both Penn and NYU I applied to their College of Arts & Sciences. 

* "Why Penn?" was the prompt, or something along those lines. I wrote about why I was interested in my intended major and my medical experiences in Nepal; I also wrote about some of their extracurricular opportunities I was interested in.

* Yes, I was also accepted to NYU[.] Shanghai campus as my second choice. I did not put down Abu Dhabi as I had no interest in studying there.

* UPenn was really pretty. I was only there for a few hours so I can't speak to it too well. Lots of traditional red brick – lots of open green spaces. UofT St. George is in the middle of downtown Toronto, huge mix of pretty and ugly buildings. I only saw NYU from the top of a bus on a hour of NYC during Columbia admit weekend. It[.] way downtown, 100% urban, complete lack of campus.  

* NYU gave me nothing, Columbia[.] FA set my family[.] contribution down to less than $5K US plus a scholarship to waive my work-study contribution for my first two years.

* I applied to all the Ivies (rejected all except Brown, deferred), and Stanford (rejected), Rice (rejected), USC (rejected), a bunch of the UCs (accepted all), UofT (accepted), McGill (accepted), UBC (accepted), Queen[.] (accepted).
